edu.cnm.deepdive.android

Class BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
      • edu.cnm.deepdive.android.BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
  • Type Parameters:
    Params - type of input parameters used by the asynchronous task (consumed by perform(Object[])), or Void if no inputs will be used.
    Progress - type of individual values provided by the asynchronous task for progress updates (consumed by onProgressUpdate(Object[])), or (usually) Void if no progress updates will be made.
    Result - type of result data produced by the background processing of the asynchronous task (returned by BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer.perform(Object[]) and consumed by onPostExecute(Object) and onCancelled(Object), or (usually) Void if the background processing is not intended to return a result.

    public class BaseFluentAsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
extends AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
    Declares methods, nested interfaces, and a nested exception class, intended to encourage a more fluent, functional, and service-oriented style of extending and using AsyncTask.

    One aim of this approach is to encourage implementation of AsyncTask subclasses that are loosely coupled with consumer logic, and easily reused. For example, if multiple activities or fragments need to perform a similar database operation, but with slight differences in UI updates and other post-processing logic, the general operation can be implemented in a single subclass of BaseFluentAsyncTask, with variations specified via lambdas in fluent invocations of setOnCompletionListener(OnResultListener), setOnProgressUpdateListener(OnProgressUpdateListener), and (possibly) setOnFailureListener(OnResultListener).

    For a simple AsyncTask implementation, with a single point of consumption, an instance of this class can be created and used, specifying all key lifecycle logic via individual lambdas or anonymous classes.

    Note that this class overrides AsyncTask.doInBackground(Object[]), splitting background processing into 2 phases: performance and observation of completion. Performance is implemented in the perform(Object[]) method, which (unless overridden) invokes BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer.perform(Object[]) on the BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer specified in setPerformer(Performer). Observation of completion is implemented by invoking BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener.handle(Object) on the BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener (if any) specified in setOnCompletionListener(OnResultListener). Simple extensions or uses of BaseFluentAsyncTask will generally only need to implement the performance phase—either by overriding perform(Params...), or by specifying a lambda or instance of an anonymous class in an invocation of setPerformer(Performer). However, splittin background processing into 2 parts gives flexibility for additional background processing, as needed.

    Important notes:

    • This class overrides and makes final the doInBackground(Object[]), onProgressUpdate(Object[]), onPostExecute(Object), and onCancelled(Object) methods. If an app needs to override these methods, then it should create a subclass of AsyncTask, rather than a subclass of BaseFluentAsyncTask.

    • If a consumer wishes the task to do nothing for one or more of the performance, observation, progress, success, or failure phases, there is no need to clear or replace the corresponding listener.

    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Nicholas Bennett, Deep Dive Coding

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnProgressUpdateListener<Progress>
      Declares an BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnProgressUpdateListener.update(Object[]) method that can be implemented to provide UI updates (for example) while a background task is ongoing.
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener<Result>
      Declares a BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener.handle(Object) method that can be implemented to perform additional processing on the UI thread following completion of background processing.
      static interface  BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer<Params,Result>
      Declares a BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer.perform(Object[]) method that can be implemented to perform basic background processing in an instance of BaseFluentAsyncTask.

    • Method Detail

      • perform

        @Nullable
protected Result perform(Params... params)
        Executes basic processing of asynchronous task. This method will always be invoked on a background thread; no UI modifications should be attempted from this method, but should instead be performed in the lambdas/interface implementations specified to setOnProgressUpdateListener(OnProgressUpdateListener), setOnSuccessListener(OnResultListener), and setOnFailureListener(OnResultListener).
        Parameters:
        params - input arguments to background processing.
        Returns:
        result. the eventual invocation of onCancelled(Object), and consequently, the lambda or BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener implementation specified to setOnFailureListener(OnResultListener).

      • doInBackground

        @SafeVarargs
 @Nullable
protected final Result doInBackground(Params... params)
        Implements the abstract AsyncTask.doInBackground(Object[]) to divide background processing into 2 components: performance and observation. Any value (including null) returned by perform(Object[]) will be passed to the BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener specified in setOnCompletionListener(OnResultListener) (if any).

        If the code of the performance phase throws a RuntimeException, or invokes AsyncTask.cancel(boolean), the observation phase will be skipped, and the listener set (if any) via setOnFailureListener(OnResultListener) will be used, instead of any listener set via setOnSuccessListener(OnResultListener).

        Subclasses of BaseFluentAsyncTask cannot override this method (since it is declared final), but can instead override perform(Object[]), or provide a lambda or BaseFluentAsyncTask.Performer implementation in an invocation of setPerformer(Performer).

        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
        Parameters:
        params - input arguments to background processing.
        Returns:
        background processing results.

      • onProgressUpdate

        @SafeVarargs
protected final void onProgressUpdate(Progress... values)
        Invokes BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnProgressUpdateListener.update(Object[]), presumably to update the UI to display the progress/status of the background processing. Rather than overriding this method (which is not possible, since the method is final), a listener should be attached by invoking setOnProgressUpdateListener(OnProgressUpdateListener) on an instance of this class or a subclass.
        Overrides:
        onProgressUpdate in class AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
        Parameters:
        values - progress

      • onPostExecute

        protected final void onPostExecute(@Nullable
                                   Result result)
        Invokes BaseFluentAsyncTask.OnResultListener.handle(Object) to perform any UI thread-based post-processing after successful completion of background processing. Rather than overriding this method (which is not possible, since the method is final), a listener should be attached by invoking setOnSuccessListener(OnResultListener) on an instance of this class or a subclass.
        Overrides:
        onPostExecute in class AsyncTask<Params,Progress,Result>
        Parameters:
        result - background processing results.

Rather than overriding this method (which is not possible, since the method is final), a listener should be attached by invoking setOnFailureListener(OnResultListener) on an instance of this class or a subclass.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
